meanings.definition: A type of polysaccharide that is an important component of connective tissues.
meanings.sent1: The glycosaminoglycan provides structure to our connective tissues.
meanings.sent2: Doctors recommend supplements containing glycosaminoglycan for joint health.
meanings.sent3: I heard a joke about a clumsy glycosaminoglycan trying to hold things together.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness acted as a glycosaminoglycan, binding our community together.
meanings.sent5: The image of glycosaminoglycan weaving through tissues stuck in my mind.

meanings.definition: A substance that helps maintain the health of cartilage and other tissues in the body.
meanings.sent1: Athletes often rely on glycosaminoglycan to support their cartilage health.
meanings.sent2: The body naturally produces glycosaminoglycan to protect tissues.
meanings.sent3: I imagined tiny glycosaminoglycan molecules repairing tissues like little handymen.
meanings.sent4: Her love acted as a soothing glycosaminoglycan for his wounded heart.
meanings.sent5: The importance of glycosaminoglycan in tissue maintenance cannot be overstated.
